document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Clayton Corrêa, Takiya, Daniela Maeda & Mejdalani, Gabriel
document.docTitle: Platypona furcata Gonçalves, Takiya & Mejdalani, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Platypona DeLong (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Iassinae: Gyponini) from Peru and key to the species of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Platypona DeLong (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Iassinae: Gyponini) from Peru and key to the species of the genus

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (mm). Male holotype : total length 9.6 ; crown median length 1.0; transocular width 2.4 ; interocular width 1.4 ; pronotum median length 1.3 ; width between humeri 2.9 ; mesonotum median length 1.6 ; mesonotum maximum width 2.2 ; forewing length 7.0; forewing maximum width 2.0.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–12.
Platypona furcata
sp. nov.
, male holotype. 1, anterior portion of body, dorsal view. 2, head, frontal view. 3, anterior portion of body, lateral view. 4, forewing. 5, hind wing. 6, sternite VIII, ventral view. 7, pygofer, anal tube, valve and subgenital plate, lateral view. 8, subgenital plate, ventral view. 9, style, lateral view. 10, connective and styles, dorsal view. 11–12, aedeagus in lateral and caudal views, respectively.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The new species name alludes to the male style, which is deeply forked ( Figs 9, 10 ).

Material examined. Male holotype : “ PERU : Cusco [Department], 3 rd km E Quincemil \
13 ° 13 ’03’’S
70 ° 43 ’ 40 ’’W
633m \
20 .VIII-01.IX. 2012
, Malaise \ RR Cavichioli, JA Rafael, APM \ Santos & DM Takiya”, “ DNA voucher\ Entomologia, DZRJ \ ENT 1218 ” ( MUSM ).

Notes.
Platypona furcata
sp. nov.
can be easily distinguished from the other species of Platypona by the black coloration of face (
Fig. 2
) and characters of the male genitalia. This new species has the following features: ( 1 ) styles ( Figs 9, 10 ) more robust with a long dorsal process near midlength (appearing deeply forked), while in P. sinverda and P. i n c a sp. nov. they are very slender and bifurcate more apically ( Figs 20, 21 ); ( 2 ) aedeagal shaft ( Figs 11, 12 ) with lateral serrated flanges at expanded portion and without processes, while P. sinverda and P. i n ca sp. nov. do not have lateral serrated flanges and have a pair of short apical processes ( Figs 22, 23 ); and ( 3 ) processes of the dorsal apodeme (
Fig. 11
) without basodorsal projection, while P. sinverda and P. i n c a sp. nov. have a dorsal projection at basal third (
Fig. 22
, arrowed).
